title: Understanding the Functions and Graph
text:
$$/lim(x$$ , -4**-,f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-4$$ from the left.
$$/lim(x$$ , -4**+,f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-4$$ from the right.
$$/lim(x$$ , $$-4$$, f(x)) is the value of f(x) as $$x$$ approaches $$-4$$ from both sides.
$$f(-4)$$ is the value of f(x) when $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-4$$.
Locate $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-4$$ on the graph and observe the values of f(x).
##figure2.gif##

title: Finding the Limit
text: What value is f(x) approaching as $$x$$ approaches -4?
